channel.title: math.CA updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.CA updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: The Boundedness of the Bilinear Fractional Integrals along Curves
item.description: arXiv:2411.14830v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, for general curves $(t,\gamma(t))$ satisfying some suitable curvature conditions, we obtain some $L^p(\mathbb{R})\times L^q(\mathbb{R}) \rightarrow L^r(\mathbb{R})$ estimates for the bilinear fractional integrals $H_{\alpha,\gamma}$ along the curves $(t,\gamma(t))$, where $$H_{\alpha,\gamma}(f,g)(x):=\int_{0}^{\infty}f(x-t)g(x-\gamma(t))\,\frac{\textrm{d}t}{t^{1-\alpha}}$$ and $\alpha\in (0,1)$. At the same time, we also establish an almost sharp Hardy-Littlewood-Sobolev inequality, i.e., the $L^p(\mathbb{R})\rightarrow L^q(\mathbb{R})$ estimate, for the fractional integral operators $I_{\alpha,\gamma}$ along the curves $(t,\gamma(t))$, where $$I_{\alpha,\gamma}f(x):=\int_{0}^{\infty}\left|f(x-\gamma(t))\right|\,\frac{\textrm{d}t}{t^{1-\alpha}}.$$
item.dc:creator: Junfeng Li, Haixia Yu, Minqun Zhao

item.title: Some sharp $L^2 \to L^p$ decay estimates for $(2+1)$-dimensional degenerate oscillatory integral operators
item.description: arXiv:2411.15009v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We investigate $(2+1)-$dimensional oscillatory integral operators characterized by polynomial phase functions. By employing Stein's complex interpolation, we derive sharp $L^2\to L^p$ decay estimates for these operators.
item.dc:creator: Shaozhen Xu

item.title: Internal waves in a 2D subcritical channel
item.description: arXiv:2411.14587v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We study scattering and evolution aspects of linear internal waves in a two dimensional channel with subcritical bottom topography. We define the scattering matrix for the stationary problem and use it to show a limiting absorption principle for the internal wave operator. As a result of the limiting absorption principle, we show the leading profile of the internal wave in the long time evolution is a standing wave whose spatial component is outgoing.
item.dc:creator: Zhenhao Li, Jian Wang, Jared Wunsch

item.title: Higher Order Approximation of Functions by Modified Goodman-Sharma Operators
item.description: arXiv:2410.06908v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Here we study the approximation properties of a modified Goodman-Sharma operator recently considered by Acu and Agrawal in 2019. This operator is linear but not positive. It has the advantage of a higher order of approximation of functions compared with the Goodman-Sharma operator. We prove direct and strong converse theorems in terms of a related K-functional.
item.dc:creator: Ivan Gadjev, Parvan Parvanov, Rumen Uluchev
